keyword: how many calories in 4 scrambled eggs
title: How Many Calories in 4 Scrambled Eggs?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in 4 scrambled eggs – about 364 kcal total – plus protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition facts, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in 4 Scrambled Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter total (minimal fat added), no milk, salt, or other ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and recipe; values can change with milk, oil, or seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Four large scrambled eggs offer ~364 kcal and ~28 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil instead of butter per egg

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What are the macros for 4 scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: ≈28 g protein, 26.8 g fat, 2.8 g carbs.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have a lot of cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, four large scrambled eggs contain ~860 mg cholesterol, mostly from yolks.

faqs.q: How does adding butter affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Minimal butter (1 tsp for 4 eggs) adds ~35 kcal total; more fat increases calories significantly.

faqs.q: Are these values for scrambled or fried eggs?
faqs.a: Specific to scrambled with minimal added fat; fried eggs may have higher calories due to more oil.
